# replaceChild(at:with:)

**Instance Method**

Replaces a child node at a specified location with another child node.

## Declaration

```swift
func replaceChild(at index: Int, with node: XMLNode)
```

## Parameters

- **index**: An integer identifying a position in the receiver’s list of children. An exception is raised if `index` is out of bounds.
- **node**: An XML node object that will replace the current child.

## Discussion

The replaced XML node object is released upon removal.

## Manipulating Child Elements

- **addChild(_:)**: Adds a child node at the end of the receiver’s current list of children.
- **insertChild(_:at:)**: Inserts a new child node at a specified location in the receiver’s list of child nodes.
- **insertChildren(_:at:)**: Inserts an array of child nodes at a specified location in the receiver’s list of children.
- **removeChild(at:)**: Removes the child node of the receiver identified by a given index.
- **setChildren(_:)**: Sets all child nodes of the receiver at once, replacing any existing children.
- **normalizeAdjacentTextNodesPreservingCDATA(_:)**: Coalesces adjacent text nodes of the receiver that you have explicitly added, optionally including CDATA sections.
